page.title: 19ST.MICHAEL'S, CHURCH BROUGH
page.content:
THE CHURCH WAS BUILT IN THE TWELFTH CENTURY.
THERE ARE THREE ROWS OF SEATS UP AT THE TOP NEAR THE ORGAN. THERE ARE TWO ROWS OF SEATS ON EITHER SIDE. AS YOU GO INTO THE CHURCH ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE THERE IS A TABLE WITH A BOOK ON IT. IN THE BOOK YOU CAN WRITE YOUR NAME AND ADDRESS. THE VICAR IS MR KENNETH CAMPELL.
AT THE BACK OF THE CHURCH THERE IS A WOODEN DOOR. INSIDE THE ROOM THERE ARE FOUR ROPES WHICH LINK UP WITH THE BELLS.
ST MICHAELS CHURCH WAS USED AS A CHURCH IN 1150. THE OLDEST PART OF THE CHURCH IS THE SOUTH WALL AND THIS NORMAN PART HAS A 15TH CENTURY GLASS WINDOW.
